title: Johnny “Joey” Jones: Small-Business Owners Should Be Person Of The Year, Not Biden/Harris
summary:
On Fox Across America with Jimmy Failla, Fox Nation's Johnny "Joey" Jones gives his suggestion for who Time Magazine should have chosen as Person Of The Year, and why it should not have been the Biden/Harris ticket.
"I am a small business owner, and that's who I think should have been the person of the year.
I think that the powers that be, especially on the liberal side of this country, truly believe Biden has saved America from Donald Trump.
They think Donald Trump is evil incarnate.
And I was so set aback that the entire conversation was this gleeful belief that now that Trump isn't going to be president, he's going to go to prison.
paragraphs: On Fox Across America with Jimmy Failla, Fox Nation's Johnny "Joey" Jones gives his suggestion for who Time Magazine should have chosen as Person Of The Year, and why it should not have been the Biden/Harris ticket.

"I am a small business owner, and that's who I think should have been the person of the year. I think that the powers that be, especially on the liberal side of this country, truly believe Biden has saved America from Donald Trump. I mean, that's what they believe. That's what they think. They think Donald Trump is evil incarnate. I sat in on a, I don't know if you call it a livestream or a Zoom and I won't name drop, but it is a recognizable group of never-Trumper/former conservatives that do this once a week for one of these publications. And I was so set aback that the entire conversation was this gleeful belief that now that Trump isn't going to be president, he's going to go to prison. They just believe everything about this man is corrupt and evil. And that's just where they are. And I could not imagine the editors at Time magazine not feeling the same way, having that same conversation, and seeing Biden as this kind of savior and then Kamala Harris as well."
